column5: They say prevention is better than cure – so join an important and growing area of healthcare to combat infection.  This course will help you develop specialist knowledge and become an expert practitioner in the field of infection prevention and control. In addition, you will gain the relevant knowledge and skills required to be an IPCP (Infection Prevention and Control Practitioner) which enables you to translate and apply these core principles across different acute and secondary healthcare settings.You will achieve the following qualifications in Infection Prevention and Control:
